events.event: Mao Zedong was born, courtesy name Yongzhi (later changed to Runzhi), childhood name "Shi San Yazi"
Returned to Shaoshan from grandfather's home and entered private school, taught by teacher Zou Chunpei
Ran to Xiangtan County town out of fear of father's punishment for skipping school, found and brought back after three days
Left home to pursue studies, left poem: "The child is determined to leave the hometown, vowing not to return unless achieving fame"
Admitted to Xiangxiang Provincial Middle School, first exposure to revolutionary thought
Participated in the Railway Protection Movement, led the cutting of pigtails
Enlisted as a soldier, participated in the Xinhai Revolution
Admitted to Hunan Provincial Fourth Normal School with top grades
Transferred to Hunan Provincial First Normal School
Traveled on foot through five Hunan counties with Xiao Zisheng for educational purposes, lasting one and a half months, covering over 900 li
Founded the New People's Study Society
Graduated from Hunan First Normal School
First arrival in Beijing to organize Hunan youth for work-study programs in France
Worked as assistant librarian at Peking University Library, met Li Dazhao through Yang Changji's introduction
Returned to Hunan due to mother's serious illness
Actively responded to the May Fourth Movement, led Hunan students' anti-imperialist patriotic movement
Founded and edited the 'Xiang River Review'
Went to Beijing again to launch the campaign to expel Zhang, then visited Chen Duxiu in Shanghai
Published 'Self-Determination for the Hunan People' in 'Shishi Xinbao'
Published 'The Fundamental Question of Hunan Reconstruction - The Hunan Republic' in 'Ta Kung Pao'
Secretly organized early Communist Party organization, established Changsha Communist Group
Attended the First National Congress of the Communist Party of China
First Congress of CPC concluded on a boat in Nanhu, the Communist Party of China was officially established
Founded the CPC Hunan Branch and served as secretary
Joined the Kuomintang during the First United Front of the KMT and CPC
Attended the Third National Congress of CPC, elected as member of the Central Executive Committee
Attended the First National Congress of the Kuomintang
Served as secretary of the Organization Department of the KMT Shanghai Executive Bureau
Also served as head of the Organization Department of the CPC Central Committee
Established the CPC Shaoshan Branch
Recommended as acting head of the KMT Propaganda Department
First close encounter with Chiang Kai-shek at the Second National Congress of the KMT
Served as director of the 6th Session of the Peasant Movement Training Institute of the KMT
Investigated peasant movement in Xiangtan, Xiangxiang, Hengshan, Liling and Changsha for 32 days
Wrote 'Report on an Investigation of the Peasant Movement in Hunan' based on the investigation
Attended the August 7th Conference, put forward the famous proposition that 'political power grows out of the barrel of a gun'
Led the Autumn Harvest Uprising on the Hunan-Jiangxi border
Presided over the 'Sanwan Reorganization'
Led the Autumn Harvest Uprising troops to arrive at Jinggangshan
Zhu-Mao Meeting, troops led by Zhu De and Chen Yi from the Nanchang Uprising successfully joined forces with Mao Zedong's Autumn Harvest Uprising troops
Held a meeting to officially announce the establishment of the Fourth Army of Workers' and Peasants' Revolutionary Army
Presided over the First Congress of the Party on the Hunan-Jiangxi border, served as secretary of the special committee
Presided over the Ninth Congress of the Fourth Red Army (Gutian Conference)
Wrote 'A Single Spark Can Start a Prairie Fire' in reply to Lin Biao
First Red Army Corps and Third Red Army Corps joined forces to form the First Red Army Front
Victory in the Battle of Longgang during the First Counter-Encirclement Campaign, captured enemy frontline commander Zhang Huizan alive
First National Congress of the Chinese Soviet Republic convened, elected as chairman of the Central Executive Committee
The Central Red Army began the Long March
Tongdao Conference, Mao proposed to abandon the plan to join the Second and Sixth Red Army Corps in western Hunan
Zunyi Conference, Mao Zedong was added as member of the CPC Central Political Bureau Standing Committee
First Crossing of Chishui River (crossed Chishui River from Tucheng after defeat in the Battle of Tucheng)
Second Crossing of Chishui River (advanced eastward from Zhaxi, crossed Chishui River via Taipingdu and Erlangtan, returned to northern Guizhou)
events.verification: According to historical records: On February 18, the vanguard Second Division of the First Red Army Corps arrived at Taipingdu, and the Third Red Army Corps arrived at Erlangtan; on February 20, all troops crossed Chishui River into northern Guizhou; on February 24, Tongzi County was captured

events.event: Third Crossing of Chishui River (crossed the river from Maotai into southern Sichuan, creating a false impression of crossing the Yangtze River northward to mislead the enemy)
events.verification: Historical records: On March 16, the Red Army crossed Chishui for the third time from Maotai using a pontoon bridge, advancing toward Gulin; on March 19, engaged and defeated Wei Kai's Sichuan forces at Zhenlongshan, entered the Lianghekou area, successfully leading Chiang Kai-shek to firmly believe in the Red Army's intention to cross the Yangtze River northward

events.event: Fourth Crossing of Chishui River (turned back and crossed eastward from southern Sichuan, successfully broke out of the Nationalist encirclement)
events.verification: Historical records: On March 21, the Red Army crossed Chishui eastward from Erlangtan, Jiuxikou, and Taipingdu; on March 24, passed through the Zunyi-Huairen road and continued southward; on March 29, captured Wujiang River crossing; on March 30-31, crossed Wujiang River southward into the northwest of Xifeng, Huanggang, Niuchang and other areas, successfully broke out of the Nationalist encirclement

events.event: Cleverly Crossed the Jinsha River (crossed Jinsha River at Jiaopingdu)
Forced Crossing of the Dadu River (crossed Dadu River at Anshunchang)
Seizing of Luding Bridge
Mao Zedong crossed Jiajin Mountain (from Baoxing to Xiaojin)

end.city: Aba Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture

events.event: Began crossing the grasslands (Zoige Grassland)

start.city: Aba Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture

end.city: Aba Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture

events.event: Ejie Conference, decided to reorganize the First and Third Army Corps and Central Column into the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army Shaan-Gan Column

start.city: Aba Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture

events.event: Successful conclusion of the Long March, Central Red Army arrived at the Shaan-Gan revolutionary base (Wuqi Town)
Wayaobu Conference, formulated the anti-Japanese national united front strategy
Served as chairman of the Central Revolutionary Military Commission
CPC Central Committee officially relocated to Yan'an, beginning '13 years in Yan'an'
Wrote 'On Practice' and 'On Contradiction'
Luochuan Conference, determined the strategic policy of prolonged war
Published 'On Protracted War'

Published the inaugural issue of 'The Communist', pointing out that the united front, armed struggle, and Party building are the three magic weapons for the Chinese Communist Party to defeat the enemy in the Chinese revolution
Published 'On New Democracy'
Rectification Movement was fully launched, delivered the report 'Rectify the Party's Style of Work'
Yan'an Forum on Literature and Art, delivered 'Talks at the Yan'an Forum on Literature and Art'
Elected as chairman of the Central Political Bureau and chairman of the Central Secretariat
Seventh National Congress of CPC, Mao Zedong Thought was established as the Party's guiding ideology
Arrived in Chongqing to begin KMT-CPC negotiations
Signed the 'Double Tenth Agreement'
Led the CPC Central Committee to evacuate Yan'an, began fighting in northern Shaanxi
Convened Xiaohe Conference, determined the deployment of strategic counteroffensive
Arrived at Xibaipo and joined with the Central Working Committee
Commanded the Liaoshen Campaign
Commanded the Huaihai Campaign
Commanded the Pingjin Campaign
Presided over the Second Plenary Session of the Seventh Central Committee of CPC, put forward the 'Two Musts'
Moved into Xiangshan (Fragrant Hills)
Issued 'Order to Advance to All of China'
Announced the founding of the People's Republic of China
First foreign visit, first meeting with (Soviet Union) Stalin
Signed the 'Sino-Soviet Treaty of Friendship, Alliance and Mutual Assistance'
Enlarged meeting of the Central Political Bureau, made the major strategic decision to 'Resist America and Aid Korea, Defend the Homeland'
Elected as the first Chairman of the People's Republic of China (First Session of the First National People's Congress)
Enlarged meeting of the Central Political Bureau, delivered important speech 'On the Ten Major Relationships'
Eighth National Congress of CPC opened, delivered opening speech
Second and last foreign visit
Inspected China's first (1955) natural gas industrial mine - Longchang Gas Mine
events.verification: http://scdfz.sc.gov.cn/whzh/slzc1/content_16893 Sichuan Party History, 1995 'Mao Zedong and Sichuan' compiled by CPC Sichuan Provincial Committee Party History Research Office

userVerification.comment: Project author's note: The first issue of this project

events.event: Second Session of the Eighth National Congress of CPC, passed the general line of 'going all out, aiming high, and achieving greater, faster, better and more economical results in building socialism'
Began shelling of Kinmen (Quemoy)
Lushan Conference, mistakenly launched the 'anti-rightist' struggle
Seven Thousand Cadres Conference, initially summarized the experience and lessons of the 'Great Leap Forward'
Launched the Four Cleanups Movement
Enlarged meeting of the Central Political Bureau passed the 'May 16 Notification', marking the official launch of the Cultural Revolution
Wrote 'Bombard the Headquarters - My Big Character Poster'
First reception of Red Guards, wearing military uniform and Red Guard armband
Presided over the Ninth National Congress of CPC, established Lin Biao as successor
Lin Biao died in plane crash, learned of the 'September 13 Incident'
Met with US President Nixon, achieved historic breakthrough in Sino-US relations
Met with Japanese Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka, decided on normalization of Sino-Japanese diplomatic relations
Presided over the last Central Political Bureau meeting
Proposed Hua Guofeng as First Vice Chairman of the CPC Central Committee
Mao Zedong's heart stopped beating, passed away at age 82
